title: Those who lied during ‘Good Governance’ era now using state institutions to justify falsehoods: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has alleged that individuals who spread falsehoods during the so-called “good governance” period are now attempting to use state institutions, including the courts, the Police and the Attorney General’s Department, to validate those lies using public funds.

title: USA player suspended from bowling in international cricket
byline: USA’s Isani Vaghela has been suspended from bowling in international cricket with immediate effect.

title: PNB seizes 5kg of heroin, nabs two suspects
byline: Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) officers arrested two suspects and seized over five kilograms of heroin during a raid carried out in the Bentota area early this morning.

title: Pakistan military says it has killed 92 militants in Balochistan
byline: Pakistan’ military says it has killed at least 92 militants blamed for deadly co-ordinated attacks in the south-western Balochistan province on Saturday.

title: Capital Airlines launches direct Beijing–Katunayake flight service
byline: China’s Capital Airlines inaugurated its direct flight service between Beijing and Sri Lanka with the arrival of its first flight at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) on the afternoon of January 31, marking a new air connectivity milestone between the two countries.

title: Eight senior police officers transferred
byline: Eight high-ranking police officers have been transferred with immediate effect, subject to the approval of the National Police Commission (NPC), Police sources said.

title: BASL condemns assault on lawyers outside Nugegoda courts
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) today strongly condemned an incident that occurred on January 30 in front of the Nugegoda Court Complex, where several Attorneys-at-Law appearing for an accused before the Magistrate’s Court of Nugegoda were allegedly assaulted.

title: Constitutional Council to consider Auditor General nomination
byline: Chief Government Whip Bimal Rathnayake said the President’s nomination for the post of Auditor General is expected to be taken up when the Constitutional Council meets today (31) for its second sitting with newly appointed civil society representatives.

title: Delays in coastal line train services today and tomorrow
byline: The trains on the coastal line will be delayed by about fifteen minutes today and tomorrow due to maintenance work being carried out between Colombo Fort and Wellawatte railway stations, the Railway Department said.

title: Ditwah continues to affect vegetable prices: Trader
byline: Cyclone Ditwah still continues to affect vegetable prices as they are higher than the usual rates, which have been at this time of the year in the past, a senior trader attached to Manning Market said yesterday.

title: Several services declared as essential services
byline: A special Gazette notification has been issued, declaring several services such as supply of electricity, distribution of fuel and hospital services as essential services.

title: Govt. hard-pressed between disaster response and IMF programme
byline: The government is encountering difficulties in funding its disaster response amid tight fiscal constraints, since the IMF stresses that spending must comply with the Public Finance Management Act (PFMA), Daily Mirror learns.

title: Gold becomes less affordable as imports remain limited
byline: In the wake of recent global market trends where gold prices climbed past the USD 5,500 per ounce mark, the Sri Lankan domestic gold market is currently sustained largely through auctions of pawned jewellery conducted by banks and financial institutions, as commercial gold imports have virtually halted due to prohibitive import duties, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Shehan Jayasuriya joins USA for 2026 T20 World Cup
byline: Former Sri Lanka international Shehan Jayasuriya has been named in the USA’s squad for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026, a week after scoring his 14th first-class century in Sri Lanka.

title: Ball now in govt.’s court: GMOA issues ultimatum
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has issued a 48-hour ultimatum to the government to address its grievances.

title: Teachers and youth betrayed after election promises: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa has accused the government of betraying young people and teachers who supported it during the period when it was in opposition.

title: USA player suspended from bowling in international cricket
byline: USA’s Isani Vaghela has been suspended from bowling in international cricket with immediate effect.

title: Pakistan forces kill 145 militants after attacks in Balochistan
byline: Pakistan’s security forces killed 145 militants over 40 hours after coordinated attacks across Balochistan, the chief minister of the southwestern province said on Sunday, as the authorities battle one of the deadliest flare-ups in years.

title: India proposes Rs. 4bn aid for Sri Lanka in 2026 Budget
byline: The Government of India has proposed an allocation of 4 billion Indian Rupees in assistance to Sri Lanka through its 2026 Budget.

title: Suspect arrested over alleged assault on lawyers
byline: The Mirihana Police arrested a suspect over the criminal intimidation of a lawyer and an attack on his vehicle following proceedings at the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: No child should miss education due to poverty – Prime Minister
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said that all government strategic plans must be designed to ensure that no child in Sri Lanka is deprived of vocational or higher education due to economic hardship.

title: Khamenei warns US of ‘regional war’ if Iran is attacked
byline: Iranian Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei has warned the United States that any attack on his country would result in a “regional war” as US President Donald Trump amasses military assets in the Middle East.

title: Riverston in Knuckles reopens to tourists
byline: The Riverston Tourist Zone in the Knuckles Forest Reserve, a UNESCO World Heritage site, has reopened to local and international visitors today (01) following closure due to damages caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Newborn baby found dead in Gregory Lake
byline: The body of a newborn baby was found floating in Gregory Lake today, the Nuwara Eliya Police said.

title: Pakistan forces kill 145 militants after attacks in Balochistan
byline: Pakistan’s security forces killed 145 militants over 40 hours after coordinated attacks across Balochistan, the chief minister of the southwestern province said on Sunday, as the authorities battle one of the deadliest flare-ups in years.

title: T20 World Cup Trophy Taken Out of Nallur Temple Complex
byline: The trophy of the T20 World Cup cricket tournament was taken out  from the premises of the Nallur Kandaswamy Temple in Jaffna.

title: Pakistan to boycott T20 World Cup 2026 match against India, but play in tournament
byline: Pakistan announced on Sunday that they will participate in the T20 World Cup 2026 but will boycott the match against India. Pakistan were scheduled to face India in a group stage match in Colombo on February 15. The decision was announced by the Government of Pakistan on their social media handle.

title: Khamenei warns US of ‘regional war’ if Iran is attacked
byline: Iranian Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei has warned the United States that any attack on his country would result in a “regional war” as US President Donald Trump amasses military assets in the Middle East.
